title: Helping African Social Savers
description: Social savings circles known by dozens of names across Africa lack digitized records and credit checks for their members.

f6_assessments.q0: There is no detail in this proposal so its ability to meet the challenge cannot be rated as effective.
f6_assessments.q1: No plan has been presented so it cannot be delivered.
f6_assessments.q2: There are no timelines or deliverables for which progress or success can be assessed against

f6_assessments.q0: This is a thought plus an idea, not a full proposal. The proposer says "applying late" and it shows.
f6_assessments.q1:
Not ready proposal.

You could study already implemented African DeFi solutions outside of the Cardano ecosystem and draw inspiration from there. Benchmark for instance Xend Finance: https://xend.finance/

Also Zidisha.org is worth checking out.
f6_assessments.q2: Needs more work. Please submit a full proposal in the next Fund.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal, as mentioned in the text, was added late into the process and it seems like the proposers didn't have enough time to update it before the deadline closed. Therefore, it is basically an idea but not really a plan, in such a way that even though the idea is good and could be successfully implemented, we can not know how it would be done and how many people would be affected, for example, without at least a basic plan. The proposal also mentions a problem to the local community of Africa, but the proposed solution seems to be general and not completely related to Africa. The proposer should articulate better how the project would bring value to the Cardano ecosystem and how it would be sustainable or how it could grow in the future, after funded and after the funding money is all used. Score: 1
f6_assessments.q1: Since much information is missing, it's not possible to know if the project would be feasible or not. The proposer background is just briefly explained, without more information to back it, like a complete bio or LinkedIn page. Also, without a plan and roadmap, it's not possible to match the proposer background with the relevant experience required to implement the solution. It's also not mentioned if the proposer would work alone or with a team, and this is also important to the proposal's budget, since it should be broken down and better explained. Besides the information already mentioned, it would be good to discuss the technical side of the implementation of such a solution based on the blockchain, and it would be good to include information about who would develop it. Also, some challenges like adoption, access to digital platforms and other related aspects could be discussed. Score: 1
f6_assessments.q2: As presented, the proposal auditability is low, since it does not show a roadmap with a plan for development, detailed explanation about each step, milestones and partial deliverables, timelines, and also some ways for the community to quantify the success of the proposal such as metrics and KPIs. In this case, some KPIs could be the number of users, number of saving circles, number of different cities/countries benefited, and other related metrics. Also, the budget should be better explained and broken down into smaller parts and related to each part of the development, so the community can follow up with the project's costs as well. Score: 1

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is not detailed and can provide absolutely no value to Cardano's ecostystem.
There is a problem statement but no solution to the problem and you come across as a scammed developer... sorry but this is not the place for that.
f6_assessments.q1: The idea can't be implemented because even if it could be a valid idea it doesn't have any detailed plan, you don't explain why you are asking for that amount of budget and you are not aligned with the goal.
f6_assessments.q2:
There are no roadmaps, milestones .
There are no delivery dates defined and there are no risks taken .

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal really identifies a problem and falls under the scope of the challenge but I am doubtful of implementation because it doesn't provide any headway of providing good solution to the problem. I believe this proposal can provide an impact to the community in Fund 7 if its well addressed and given good solution.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal does not provide any roadmap and adequate solutions to this problem. There is also no experience and lacks team who will carry out the project, the budget given to solve the problem is unrealistic considering not providing any roadmap and solution to the problem.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal does not provide timelines of how the funds is going to be spent and also lacks transparency.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem statement and solution are reasonable and are in line with the challenge, but the proposal is only a draft.
There is not enough information to assess impact. I would recommend checking the Catalyst documentation for reference to create a new proposal and search for an appropriate challenge to submit the proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: Draft proposal. There is not enough information to assess feasibility. I would recommend checking the Catalyst documentation for reference to create a new proposal and search for an appropriate challenge to submit the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: Draft proposal. There is not enough information to assess auditability. I would recommend checking the Catalyst documentation for reference to create a new proposal and search for an appropriate challenge to submit the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: Saving circles in Africa could greatly benefit from Cardano's transparency and immutability.
f6_assessments.q1: There is no implementation plan for the project and the experience of the proposers is unclear. Adding a plan for the project and more information about the proposers would improve the project's feasibility.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal lacks milestones and specific goals to be achieved. Making a list of requirements to be met by the proposed banking network would be helpful.

f6_assessments.q0: I get the basic intent behind the proposal but it's sparse  in terms of detail, including how it works, or how it would be implemented. Seems like this is because the proposal was put through late
f6_assessments.q1: There is not enough detail about the proposer aside from being a "developer" to know if this can be successfully implemented. The lack of details about the proposal makes it hard to know what the plan even is.
f6_assessments.q2: There are no details about performance/success benchmarks, how the money is to be deployed, etc. It's therefore not possible to audit the project to determine success.

f6_assessments.q0: I think this is a good idea but this proposal does not have enough information on how it would be established
f6_assessments.q1: With the given information I do not think this proposal would be implemented successfully especially with what was written in the relevant experience where they were swindled for 10k. f6_assessments.q2: As mentioned the idea is great but more information is needed on how this project would be accomplished and planned.

f6_assessments.q0: I think the proposal has high merits and it is a great idea to create security and confidence in providing lending services as this is required for trust but there needs to be more information what will be done to achieve so and which parties would be involved or Dapp to curate it.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer expands on his experience in programming and have had some experience presented by his argument bit I believe more of a roadmap, what kind of processes and who are the key players are in working uts solution.
f6_assessments.q2: I believe more details are required to assess the auditability of this proposal. Is quite rudimentary but nonetheless pivotal to build Africa and the infrastructure needed to achieve its goal with the blockchain.

f6_assessments.q0: The information is sketchy and incomplete, does not clearly state the implementation objectives as well as the plan
f6_assessments.q1: The information is sketchy and incomplete, not clearly stating the implementation objectives as well as plans. Lack of risk assessment
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap is not clear, the solution has not been specified

solution: A blockchain-based 'last billion banking network' to support saving circles with record keeping and credit check.
experience: I am a developer/saver who got swindled by one member who ran away with $10K. This happens a lot because community trust was abused.
